title: Is outsourcing a good thing? - Quora

response.answer_text: As I am associated with outsourcing industry since 2010, I am able to explain to you outsourcing is a good thing. Let me explain, how? Outsourcing is the word used the entire business industry to refer to the allocation of business processes to outside businesses. The process of giving particular office and business work to outside service providers is fast becoming the norm. Things from production, IT services, legal and accounting services, customer service, and logistics are usually relegated to outside professionals. The transforming idea of business offices basically dissolved the office walls. With the strength of the internet, advanced telecommunications programs and systems, and advanced technical gadgetry, it is now easy to share, communicate, and send files, presentations, and projects everywhere worldwide, like you are in an exact place. Outsourcing is the process of hiring outside organizations to handle work in the company generally done by the employees. And simply put, to an extent it’s a good thing; many entrepreneurs prefer to outsource many non-core business activities to focus on the core ones. Controls capital costs. Cost-cutting is one of the many reasons to outsource non-core business activities. Outsourcing helps in converting capital costs into variable costs, and also helps you invest in more strong bounds of business. Outsourcing makes your firm very appealing to investors, since your focus would be on the core competencies of the business. Increases efficiency. It’s highly inefficient to do everything by yourself. As a result of doing research, development, marketing, and distribution, expenses inside the company will sky-rocket, and the absolute as well as the opportunity cost will be higher. That’s why entrepreneurs, and huge companies for that matter, outsource as much non-core work as they can. Reduce labor costs. With more side-projects in your lap, you’ll find yourself surrounded with many employees for short-term basis which most of the time don’t live up to your expectations. Outsourcing lets you focus your human resources where you need them the most. Focus on your core business. If too much focus is put to the peripheral works, there are chances your business would struggle with core competencies and the quality of your flagship product and service can go down drastically, which could be quite visible with bumps in revenue. Reduce risk. All of the above points increase the risk of doing business in short-term as well as in long-term. Markets, competition, government regulations, financial conditions, and technologies all change very quickly. Outsourcing provides a safe assurance from all these risks, as the Outsourcing providers assume and manage this risk for you, and they are highly competent with that particular work. Outsourcing is one of the most common practices conducted in business. In short, it frees you from unnecessary hassle and helps you focus your resources on things that matter.
